item.title: Getting Twitter URL’s right with Bit.ly Shortlinks by Yoast
item.description: Integrating Twitter with WordPress is pretty easy to do without a plugin. With a few lines of code you can have a nice tweet this or follow me button on every post or page of your WordPress website. However, the URL that is part of the Tweet is the permalink URL and for many sites you’ll want to Tweet a shortened URL. If like me, using Bit.ly and Yoast’s Bitly Shortlink plugin, you maybe wondering how to get your short Bit.

item.title: damiens.ws – A new look to Twitter via Bit.ly Pro
item.description: I’ve made a change to my Bit.ly Pro setup and switched to the domain damiens.ws for my URL shortener. This will benefit me and you – the new domain damiens.ws is registered for 10 years. You’ll continue to get the same great news and views from yours truly if you follow me on Twitter @damiensaunders You’ll see more changes like this to come – I suggest a single name brand might be one ‘strategy’ that I’m going to follow.

item.title: Bit.ly Making offline marketing work for social media with URL shortener
item.description: Engagement metrics and CPE are going to become more popular this year and next year, and so how do you take the offline world online? Or how can you start track the value of that billboard you just spent 10,000,000 dollars on? Well that looks obvious! So how are you tracking offline to online engagement? At the moment Bit.ly Pro offers free service – you provide a customer domain or sub domain and it does the rest.
